nano.remexp.broadcaster
Class RemoteExperimentMonitor

java.lang.Object
  nano.remexp.ThreadHandler
      nano.remexp.broadcaster.RemoteExperimentMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class RemoteExperimentMonitor
extends ThreadHandler

This class is a monitor state of the remote experiment. It handles incomming client requests and checks whether they are valid. It establishes locks according to the current state of the remote experiment and releases them either because of information that is sent from the remote experiment or the clients, or if the lock times out.

Version:
1.1 23.08.2012
Author:
Dominic Bosch

Constructor Detail

RemoteExperimentMonitor

public RemoteExperimentMonitor(FilteringPool chief)
The constructor for this command processing class. It links to the FilteringPool instance to pass actions towards the remote experiment server.

Parameters:
chief - The restricted server instance that runs as middleware between the clients and the remote experiments server.
Method Detail

initRemExp

protected void initRemExp()
Initializes the remote experiment by aborting eventual locks and setting the remote experiment into a calibrated stage.

Sets and stores the name of the remote experiment

Parameters:

addSample

protected void addSample(int sid,
                         java.lang.String sampleName,
                         java.lang.String cmd,
                         java.lang.String rel,
                         int tipX,
                         int tipY,
                         int dX,
                         int dY)
Stores sample information in a GotoLock and makes it ready to be called by the client.

Parameters:
sid - the sample id
sampleName - the sample name
cmd - the command to the remote experiment moving to the sample
rel - the command sent by the remote experiment, indicating the movement to the sample succeeded
tipX - the initial x position of the tip at this sample
tipY - the initial y position of the tip at this sample
dX - the maximum distance allowed away from the initial tip position in x direction
dY - the maximum distance allowed away from the initial tip position in y direction

Parameters:
isConnected - true if connected, else false

This method is used to set and broadcast the actual state of the remote experiment.

Parameters:

sendCurrentStateTo

protected void sendCurrentStateTo(EventSocket sock)
Informs the new client about the current state of the remote experiment. Sets the correct parameters in the gui when a new client connects or changes his privileges.

Parameters:
sock - The socket that needs to be informed.

printCurrentState

protected void printCurrentState()
Prints the current state of the remote experiment.

isValidRemExpCommand

protected boolean isValidRemExpCommand(java.lang.String msg)
Checks whether the command is known for the remote experiment.

Parameters:
msg - The string containing the command=value pair.
Returns:
True if the command is valid for the remote experiment, else false.

getLockForCommand

public LockHolder getLockForCommand(java.lang.String msg)
Searches for the LockHolder associated with the value for the command tag.

Parameters:
msg - The string holding the command=value pair.
Returns:
The LockHolder if the command exists, or null.

addClientRequest

protected void addClientRequest(java.lang.String message,
                                EventSocket sock)
Receives a client event and searches for the command=value value in order to determine whether this command is allowed to be passed to the remote experiment and whether a lock needs to be set until the action is finished and the remote experiment answered to be ready again.

Parameters:
message - Has the form 'command=adjustaxis name=x value=500'
sock - the client socket that sent the message

handleRemExpEvent

public void handleRemExpEvent(java.lang.String msg)
Handles an event coming from the remote experiment. It tests for a present lock that needs to be released and passes it the message that maybe removes this lock.

Parameters:
msg - The plain message coming from the remote experiment.

setLock

public void setLock(LockHolder lock)
This function is used by the commandProcessor of the remote experiment to lock or unlock the access to the remote experiment by the clients.

Parameters:
lock - The lock that needs to be set, or null if the lock is empty.

doTask

public void doTask()
Checks the lockHolder for timeout on the lock.

doTask in class ThreadHandler

Clearing the commandLocks hash table and stopping the thread.
